title: [K-12] Serious Game-Based Science Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced knowledge in scientific disciplines and comprehension of research methodologies
context.additional_context: Students perform real-world science problem-solving simulations in a virtual clinic environment, enhancing knowledge application and creative thinking through game-based tasks aligned with Bloom’s Taxonomy.

learning_goals: Learners can successfully complete at least 80% of game-based tasks designed according to Bloom’s Taxonomy six levels (Remembering–Understanding–Applying–Analyzing–Evaluating–Creating).
Learners can simulate scientific problem-solving processes in a virtual environment, improving real-world research design skills by 30%.
Through in-game collaboration features, learners can share knowledge, provide feedback to peers at least five times, and enhance teamwork skills.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
